info.title: Hedera JSON-RPC Specification
info.description: A specification of the implemented Ethereum JSON RPC APIs interface for Hedera clients and adheres to the Ethereum execution APIs schema.

servers.name: Mainnet
servers.description: Hedera Mainnet endpoint, hosted by [Hashio](https://swirldslabs.com/hashio/), a JSON-RPC Relay Community Service. Rate limited based [on IP address](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/rate-limiting.md) and [on global HBAR spend](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/hbar-limiting.md).

servers.name: Testnet
servers.description: Hedera Testnet endpoint, hosted by [Hashio](https://swirldslabs.com/hashio/), a JSON-RPC Relay Community Service. Rate limited based [on IP address](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/rate-limiting.md) and [on global HBAR spend](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/hbar-limiting.md).

servers.name: Previewnet
servers.description: Hedera Previewnet endpoint, hosted by [Hashio](https://swirldslabs.com/hashio/), a JSON-RPC Relay Community Service. Rate limited based [on IP address](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/rate-limiting.md) and [on global HBAR spend](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/hbar-limiting.md).

servers.name: localhost
servers.description: Run your own instance of [`hiero-json-rpc-relay`](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay) on `localhost`, and configure it connect to your choice of Hedera networks. No rate limits apply.

servers.name: WS Mainnet
servers.description: Hedera Web Socket Mainnet endpoint, hosted by [Hashio](https://swirldslabs.com/hashio/), a JSON-RPC Relay Community Service. Rate limited based [on IP address](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/rate-limiting.md) and [on global HBAR spend](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/hbar-limiting.md).

servers.name: WS Testnet
servers.description: Hedera Web Socket Testnet endpoint, hosted by [Hashio](https://swirldslabs.com/hashio/), a JSON-RPC Relay Community Service. Rate limited based [on IP address](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/rate-limiting.md) and [on global HBAR spend](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/hbar-limiting.md).

servers.name: WS Previewnet
servers.description: Hedera Web Socket Previewnet endpoint, hosted by [Hashio](https://swirldslabs.com/hashio/), a JSON-RPC Relay Community Service. Rate limited based [on IP address](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/rate-limiting.md) and [on global HBAR spend](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/blob/main/docs/hbar-limiting.md).

servers.name: WS localhost
servers.description: Run your own instance of Web Socket [`hiero-json-rpc-relay`](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay) on `localhost`, and configure it connect to your choice of Hedera networks. No rate limits apply.

methods.name: eth_accounts
methods.summary: Returns a list of addresses owned by client.

methods.name: eth_blockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of most recent block.

methods.name: eth_call
methods.summary: Executes a new message call immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.

methods.name: eth_chainId
methods.summary: Returns the chain ID of the current network.

methods.name: eth_coinbase
methods.summary: Always returns UNSUPPORTED_METHOD error.

methods.name: eth_blobBaseFee
methods.summary: Always returns UNSUPPORTED_METHOD error.

methods.name: eth_estimateGas
methods.summary: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete.

methods.name: eth_feeHistory
methods.summary: Returns transaction base fee per gas and effective priority fee per gas for the requested/supported block range.

params.name: blockCount
params.description: Requested range of blocks. Clients will return less than the requested range if not all blocks are available.

params.name: newestBlock
params.description: Highest block of the requested range.

params.name: rewardPercentiles
params.description: A monotonically increasing list of percentile values. For each block in the requested range, the transactions will be sorted in ascending order by effective tip per gas and the coresponding effective tip for the percentile will be determined, accounting for gas consumed.

result.name: feeHistoryResult
result.description: Fee history for the returned block range. This can be a subsection of the requested range if not all blocks are available.

gasUsedRatio.title: gasUsedRatio
gasUsedRatio.description: An array of gas used ratio.

baseFeePerGas.title: baseFeePerGas
baseFeePerGas.description: An array of block base fees per gas. This includes the next block after the newest of the returned range.

reward.title: reward
reward.description: A two-dimensional array of effective priority fees per gas at the requested block percentiles.

items.title: rewardPercentile
items.description: An array of effective priority fee per gas data points from a single block. All zeroes are returned if the block is empty.

methods.name: eth_gasPrice
methods.summary: Returns the current price per gas in weibars.

methods.name: eth_getBalance
methods.summary: Returns the balance of the account of given address.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByHash
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by hash.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByNumber
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by number.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

methods.name: eth_getCode
methods.summary: Returns code at a given address.

methods.name: eth_getLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching a given filter object.
methods.description:
The block range filter, _i.e._, `fromBlock` and `toBlock` arguments, cannot be larger than `ETH_GET_LOGS_BLOCK_RANGE_LIMIT` (defaults to `1000`). However, when `address` represents a single address, either a `string` or an array with a single element, this restriction is lifted. In any case, if the `topics` param is present the block range must be within ~`302,400` blocks, the equivalent to 7 days.

When the logs for an individual address exceeds `MIRROR_NODE_CONTRACT_RESULTS_LOGS_PG_MAX * MIRROR_NODE_LIMIT_PARAM` (defaults to `20k`) an error `-32011` _Mirror Node pagination count range too large_ is returned. These settings are the Mirror Node page limit (defaults to `200`) and Mirror Node entries per page (defaults to `100`) respectively. ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/main/docs/images/http_label.png) ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-json-rpc-relay/main/docs/images/ws_label.png)

methods.name: eth_getStorageAt
methods.summary: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address and block. The optional block param may be latest or a valid tag of a historical block.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a transaction by block hash and transaction index position.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a transaction by block number and transaction index position.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByHash
methods.summary: Returns the information about a transaction requested by transaction hash.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionCount
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions sent from an address.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionReceipt
methods.summary: Returns the receipt of a transaction by transaction hash.

methods.name: eth_getUncleByBlockHashAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a uncle of a block by hash and uncle index position.

schema.description: Always returns null. There are no uncles in Hedera.

methods.name: eth_getUncleByBlockNumberAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a uncle of a block by number and uncle index position.

schema.description: Always returns null. There are no uncles in Hedera.

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

schema.description: Always returns '0x0'. There are no uncles in Hedera.
schema.title: hex encoded unsigned integer

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

oneOf.title: Block tag
oneOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

schema.description: Always returns '0x0'. There are no uncles in Hedera.
schema.title: hex encoded unsigned integer

methods.name: eth_getWork
methods.summary: Always returns UNSUPPORTED_METHOD error.

methods.name: eth_hashrate
methods.summary: Returns the number of hashes per second that the node is mining with. Always returns 0x0.

methods.name: eth_maxPriorityFeePerGas
methods.summary: Returns a fee per gas that is an estimate of how much you can pay as a priority fee, or 'tip', to get a transaction included in the current block.

schema.description: Always returns '0x0'. Hedera doesn't have a concept of tipping nodes to promote any behavior
schema.title: hex encoded unsigned integer

methods.name: eth_mining
methods.summary: Returns whether the client is a miner. We don't mine, so this always returns false.

methods.name: eth_newBlockFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter object, to notify of newly created blocks.

methods.name: eth_newFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter object, based on filter options, to notify when the state changes (logs).

methods.name: eth_uninstallFilter
methods.summary: Uninstalls a filter with given id.

methods.name: eth_newPendingTransactionFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when new pending transactions arrive.

methods.name: eth_getFilterLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching the filter with the given ID (created using `eth_newFilter`).

methods.name: eth_getFilterChanges
methods.summary: Polling method for the filter with the given ID (created using `eth_newFilter`). Returns an array of logs which occurred since last poll.

methods.name: eth_protocolVersion
methods.summary: Always returns UNSUPPORTED_METHOD error.

methods.name: eth_sendRawTransaction
methods.summary: Submits a raw transaction. You can create and sign a transaction externally using a library such as [web3.js](https://web3js.readthedocs.io/) or [ethers.js](https://docs.ethers.org/). For [EIP-4844](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4844) transactions, the raw form must be the network form. This means it includes the blobs, KZG commitments, and KZG proofs. For [EIP-7594](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7594) transactions, the raw format must be the network form. This means it includes the blobs, KZG commitments, and cell proofs. The logic for handling the new transaction during fork boundaries are 1. When receiving an encoded transaction with cell proofs before the PeerDAS fork activates, we reject it. Only blob proofs are accepted into the pool. 2. At the time of fork activation, the implementer could (not mandatory) - Drop all old-format transactions - Convert old proofs to new format (computationally expensive) - Convert only when including in a locally produced block 3. After the fork has activated, only txs with cell proofs are accepted via p2p relay. 4. On RPC (eth_sendRawTransaction), txs with blob proofs may still be accepted and will be auto-converted by the node. At implementer discretion, this facility can be deprecated later when users have switched to new client libraries that can create cell proofs.

methods.name: eth_sendTransaction
methods.summary: Signs and submits a transaction.

schema.title: Transaction object generic to all types

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

maxFeePerBlobGas.title: max fee per blob gas
maxFeePerBlobGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay for blob gas in wei

blobVersionedHashes.title: blobVersionedHashes
blobVersionedHashes.description: List of versioned blob hashes associated with the transaction's EIP-4844 data blobs.

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID on which this transaction is valid

yParity.title: yParity
yParity.description: The parity (0 for even, 1 for odd) of the y-value of the secp256k1 signature

methods.name: eth_signTransaction
methods.summary: Returns an RLP encoded transaction signed by the specified account.

schema.title: Transaction object generic to all types

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

maxFeePerBlobGas.title: max fee per blob gas
maxFeePerBlobGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay for blob gas in wei

blobVersionedHashes.title: blobVersionedHashes
blobVersionedHashes.description: List of versioned blob hashes associated with the transaction's EIP-4844 data blobs.

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID on which this transaction is valid

yParity.title: yParity
yParity.description: The parity (0 for even, 1 for odd) of the y-value of the secp256k1 signature

methods.name: eth_sign
methods.summary: Returns an EIP-191 signature over the provided data.

methods.name: eth_submitHashrate
methods.summary: Always returns UNSUPPORTED_METHOD error.

methods.name: eth_submitWork
methods.summary: Used for submitting a proof-of-work solution.

methods.name: eth_syncing
methods.summary: Returns an object with data about the sync status or false.

oneOf.title: Not syncing
oneOf.description: Should always return false if not syncing.

methods.name: net_listening
methods.summary: Returns true if client is actively listening for network connections.

methods.name: net_version
methods.summary: Returns the current chain id.

methods.name: net_peerCount
methods.summary: Always returns UNSUPPORTED_METHOD error.

methods.name: web3_clientVersion
methods.summary: Returns the current client version.

methods.name: web3_sha3
methods.summary: Returns sha3 of the input.

methods.name: eth_subscribe
methods.summary: Creates a new subscription for desired events. Sends data as soon as it occurs.

params.name: subscription_type
params.description: The type of event you want to subscribe to.

params.name: options

address.description: Single address or array of addresses to restrict the logs.

topics.description: Array of topics used to filter logs.

params.description: Filter options for the subscription. Required for 'logs' type.

result.name: subscription_id
result.description: The hex encoded subscription ID used to identify and manage the subscription.

methods.name: eth_unsubscribe
methods.summary: Cancels a subscription.

result.name: success
result.description: True if the subscription was successfully cancelled, otherwise false.

methods.name: debug_traceTransaction
methods.summary: Attempts to run the transaction in the exact same manner as it was executed on the network.

params.name: transactionHash
params.description: The hash of the transaction to trace.

params.name: tracer
params.description: Specifies the type of tracer or configuration object for the tracer.

result.name: trace
result.description: The trace object containing detailed information about the transaction execution, encapsulated in a call frame.

methods.name: debug_traceBlockByNumber
methods.summary: Returns the tracing result for all transactions in the block specified by number with a tracer.

params.name: tracerOptions

tracer.description: The type of tracer to use. Either 'callTracer' or 'prestateTracer'.

tracerConfig.description: Configuration options for the specified tracer

onlyTopCall.description: When set to true, this will only trace the primary (top-level) call and not any sub-calls.

params.description: Specifies the type of tracer and optional configuration. Supported tracers are 'callTracer' and 'prestateTracer'.

result.name: traces

type.description: The type of action (CALL for function calls or CREATE for contract creation).

to.description: The address of the receiver. In the case of a contract creation, this might be null.

value.description: The value transferred with the call, in hexadecimal.

gas.description: The gas provided for the call, in hexadecimal.

gasUsed.description: The gas used during the call, in hexadecimal.

input.description: The input data sent with the call.

output.description: The output data returned by the call.

error.description: Error encountered during the call, if any.

calls.description: Sub-calls made during this call frame.

oneOf.title: Prestate Tracer Response
oneOf.description: prestateTracer response format - an object where keys are ethereum addresses and values contain account state data

balance.description: The balance of the account/contract, expressed in wei and encoded as a hexadecimal string

nonce.description: The latest nonce of the account, represented as an unsigned integer. Historical nonces are not supported by now.

code.description: The bytecode of the contract, encoded as a hexadecimal string. If the account is not a contract, this will be an empty hex string (0x).

storage.description: A map of key-value pairs representing the storage slots of the contract. The keys and values are both encoded as hexadecimal strings. If the account is not a contract, this will be an empty object ({}).

result.description: An array of trace objects containing detailed information about all transactions in the block. For callTracer, each item is a call frame with transaction details. For prestateTracer, each item is an object mapping addresses to their account state.

methods.name: eth_getProof
methods.summary: Returns the merkle proof for a given account and optionally some storage keys.

schema.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

methods.name: eth_createAccessList
methods.summary: Generates an access list for a transaction.

methods.name: eth_getBlockReceipts
methods.summary: Returns the receipts of a block by number or hash.

schema.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

to.title: to
to.description: Address of the receiver or null in a contract creation transaction.

cumulativeGasUsed.title: cumulative gas used
cumulativeGasUsed.description: The sum of gas used by this transaction and all preceding transactions in the same block.

gasUsed.title: gas used
gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used for this specific transaction alone.

blobGasUsed.title: blob gas used
blobGasUsed.description: The amount of blob gas used for this specific transaction. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

contractAddress.title: contract address
contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null.

root.title: state root
root.description: The post-transaction state root. Only specified for transactions included before the Byzantium upgrade.

status.title: status
status.description: Either 1 (success) or 0 (failure). Only specified for transactions included after the Byzantium upgrade.

effectiveGasPrice.title: effective gas price
effectiveGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account. Before EIP-1559, this is equal to the transaction's gas price. After, it is equal to baseFeePerGas + min(maxFeePerGas - baseFeePerGas, maxPriorityFeePerGas).

blobGasPrice.title: blob gas price
blobGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account for blob gas. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

type.description: The type of action (CALL for function calls or CREATE for contract creation).

to.description: The address of the receiver. In the case of a contract creation, this might be null.

value.description: The value transferred with the call, in hexadecimal.

gas.description: The gas provided for the call, in hexadecimal.

gasUsed.description: The gas used during the call, in hexadecimal.

input.description: The input data sent with the call.

output.description: The output data returned by the call.

error.description: Error encountered during the call, if any.

BlockTag.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `latest` | `pending` | 'finalized' | 'safe' : The most recent block.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

yParity.title: yParity
yParity.description: The parity (0 for even, 1 for odd) of the y-value of the secp256k1 signature.

v.title: v
v.description: For backwards compatibility, `v` is optionally provided as an alternative to `yParity`. This field is DEPRECATED and all use of it should migrate to `yParity`.

to.title: to
to.description: Address of the receiver or null in a contract creation transaction.

cumulativeGasUsed.title: cumulative gas used
cumulativeGasUsed.description: The sum of gas used by this transaction and all preceding transactions in the same block.

gasUsed.title: gas used
gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used for this specific transaction alone.

contractAddress.title: contract address
contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null.

root.title: state root
root.description: The post-transaction state root. Only specified for transactions included before the Byzantium upgrade.

status.title: status
status.description: Either 1 (success) or 0 (failure). Only specified for transactions included after the Byzantium upgrade.

effectiveGasPrice.title: effective gas price
effectiveGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the senders account. Before EIP-1559, this is equal to the transaction's gas price. After, it is equal to baseFeePerGas + min(maxFeePerGas - baseFeePerGas, maxPriorityFeePerGas).

type.description: The type of action (CALL for function calls or CREATE for contract creation).

to.description: The address of the receiver. In the case of a contract creation, this might be null.

value.description: The value transferred with the call, in hexadecimal.

gas.description: The gas provided for the call, in hexadecimal.

gasUsed.description: The gas used during the call, in hexadecimal.

input.description: The input data sent with the call.

output.description: The output data returned by the call.

error.description: Error encountered during the call, if any.

calls.description: Sub-calls made during this call frame.
